dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-codecov
dependent_to.description: Hosted coverage reports for Github, Bitbucket and Gitlab.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfaidx
dependent_to.description: pyfaidx: efficient pythonic random access to fasta subsequences

dependent_to.name: nrm
dependent_to.description: Node Resource Manager

dependent_to.name: py-fiona
dependent_to.description: Fiona reads and writes spatial data files.

dependent_to.name: py-rosdistro
dependent_to.description: A tool to work with rosdistro files.

dependent_to.name: isescan
dependent_to.description:
A python pipeline to identify IS (Insertion Sequence) elements in genome
and metagenome

dependent_to.name: py-csvkit
dependent_to.description:
A library of utilities for working with CSV, the king of tabular file
formats

dependent_to.name: py-opentuner
dependent_to.description: An extensible framework for program autotuning.

dependent_to.name: py-pypinyin
dependent_to.description: Chinese Pinyin conversion module/tool.

dependent_to.name: oclint
dependent_to.description:
OClint: a static analysis tool for C, C++, and Objective-C code OCLint
is a static code analysis tool for improving quality and reducing
defects by inspecting C, C++ and Objective-C code and looking for
potential problems

dependent_to.name: lbann
dependent_to.description:
LBANN: Livermore Big Artificial Neural Network Toolkit. A distributed
memory, HPC-optimized, model and data parallel training toolkit for deep
neural networks.

dependent_to.name: httpie
dependent_to.description: Modern, user-friendly command-line HTTP client for the API era.

dependent_to.name: py-catkin-pkg
dependent_to.description: Library for retrieving information about catkin packages.

dependent_to.name: py-plac
dependent_to.description: The smartest command line arguments parser in the world.

dependent_to.name: py-numba
dependent_to.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM

dependent_to.name: py-future
dependent_to.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2

dependent_to.name: py-vcstool
dependent_to.description:
vcstool enables batch commands on multiple different vcs repositories.
Currently it supports git, hg, svn and bzr.

dependent_to.name: py-rospkg
dependent_to.description: Library for retrieving information about ROS packages and stacks.

dependent_to.name: py-memprof
dependent_to.description:
memprof logs and plots the memory usage of all the variables during the
execution of the decorated methods.

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-scoop
dependent_to.description:
SCOOP (Scalable COncurrent Operations in Python) is a distributed task
module allowing concurrent parallel programming on various environments,
from heterogeneous grids to supercomputers.

dependent_to.name: hicops
dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.

dependent_to.name: py-argh
dependent_to.description:
An argparse wrapper that doesn't make you say "argh" each time you deal
with it. Building a command-line interface? Found yourself uttering
"argh!" while struggling with the API of argparse? Don't like the
complexity but need the power? Argh is a smart wrapper for argparse.
Argparse is a very powerful tool; Argh just makes it easy to use.

dependent_to.name: py-websocket-client
dependent_to.description: WebSocket client for Python. hybi13 is supported.

dependent_to.name: git-imerge
dependent_to.description:
git-imerge: Incremental merge & rebase for git Perform a merge between
two branches incrementally. If conflicts are encountered, figure out
exactly which pairs of commits conflict, and present the user with one
pairwise conflict at a time for resolution. git-imerge has two primary
design goals: * Reduce the pain of resolving merge conflicts to its
unavoidable minimum, by finding and presenting the smallest possible
conflicts: those between the changes introduced by one commit from each
branch. * Allow a merge to be saved, tested, interrupted, published, and
collaborated on while it is in progress.

dependent_to.name: py-pyvcf
dependent_to.description: A Variant Call Format reader for Python

dependent_to.name: py-fortran-language-server
dependent_to.description:
A Fortran implementation of the Language Server Protocol using Python
(2.7+ or 3.0+).

dependent_to.name: py-unittest2
dependent_to.description:
unittest2 is a backport of the new features added to the unittest
testing framework in Python 2.7 and onwards.

dependent_to.name: awscli
dependent_to.description:
This package provides a unified command line interface to Amazon Web
Services
